Sawaddee ka welcome to hot Thai kitchen so 
lately I've been getting tired of my usual

breakfast routine so I was looking for some new 
ideas and I was reminded of this dish that's very

popular in the north eastern part of Thailand 
and it's called kai grata kai is eggs and grata

is pan so they're eggs it's cooked and served in 
a tiny little pan it's so cute and it's actually

a dish that I believe originally came to Thailand 
from Vietnam so if you're from Vietnam you might

have something similar and if you do the prep in 
advance it'll actually take you minutes to put

together in the morning so it's perfect so let's 
get started so first I'm going to just prep my

proteins and this is the part you want to do in 
advance so comes morning up you just assemble so

I've got here some Chinese sausage or lap Cheong 
that's what it's called in Cantonese and you can

find this at any Chinese grocery store this one 
is pork and chicken you can get one that's just

pork there's also a liver one so whichever one 
you like it's a little bit sweet and it's got a

firm texture much like salami and in Thai this 
is called good chia now since I said this is a

Vietnamese influenced dish we're going to use 
Vietnamese ham so I talked about this before in

my Bonnie episode this is Dalia or in time ooh yah 
and you can find this also at any Chinese grocery

store so good we make this into a salad we focus 
on noodle soups now my third protein is what I

would consider the most important one so if you 
just have one thing this will be it and that is

seasoned ground pork if you don't eat pork ground 
chicken or ground beef will do just fine adds a

little texture so I am going to add some oyster 
sauce to my ground pork here and also some Maggi

seasoning now I love using Maggi on my eggs for 
breakfast so that's why I wanted to add the Maggi

in the pork now what is Maggie you ask if you 
don't know you must try it so this is a type of

seasonings also type of soy sauce basically 
but it's got sort of an a flavor similar to

the golden Mountain sauce that I use a lot but but 
also different it's a classic sauce to put on eggs

in the morning and that's it I like to keep the 
seasoning simple I mean it's breakfast you don't

want to make it complicated if you've got time you 
can grate a little clove of garlic in there if you

want put some white pepper or black pepper up to 
you now you've been following me you know that I

like to add a little sugar to balance the salt but 
in this case the quenching and mooyah are already

quite sweet so I'm not going to need to add any 
sugar so if you're using other kinds of sausages

that are not sweet you may want to add just a 
touch of sugar to this and it'll help balance

everything out nicely all right so I'm just gonna 
sear off some meat so that I get some browning on

it and again if you want to have this ready for 
like a weekday morning I would do this ahead of

time get a nice browning on it and then on the 
day just pop it in the microwave for 30 seconds

okay and because there's sugar in these it'll 
Brown quite quickly so keep an eye on it now

this looks perfect okay and now I'm going to just 
cook off my pork and if you don't want to add any

more oil you can ruin it the way everyone pork 
for a lap and that's just using water the point

of the water is just to lubricate the pan prevent 
the pork from sticking you don't want to you know

boil the pork away all right I'm happy with that 
I'm gonna turn this off and we toss in some green

onions just for some freshness and that is it all 
right so the most important part about making cake

Pat is finding the right path for your Chi okay so 
this dish is served in the pan that it's cooked in

so you want a pan that's just big enough to fit 
two eggs so if with two eggs in here it'll fill

the pan completely if you want three eggs then 
obviously you can go a little bigger now if you

don't have a pan like this you can just use a 
small saute pan non-stick pan and then you just

have to slide it out and serve it on a regular 
plate but this is kind of nice and has a an

authentic feel to it so I'm going to heat this up 
so for this I want low heat because I don't want

the bottom of the eggs to burn so medium low but 
with this particular pad because it's not nonstick

in order to prevent the eggs I'm sticking I want 
to heat the pan until it's hot first before I add

my ingredients to test whether it's hot enough 
what I do is I just sprinkle a little water

it's not hot enough yet what you're looking for is 
for the water to become little balls just running

around in the pan that's when you know it's hot 
enough okay that's perfect see how when I sprinkle

the water is like running around in little balls 
perfect so I'm going to let that dry and then add

my butter yes you want butter for this butter goes 
in the butter should start to sizzle yes it's a

lot of butter that's why it's good once the butter 
is melted I'm going in with my two eggs right away

there we go and you see how the eggs just sort 
of fill the pan up nicely by the way the pan is

16 centimeter in diameter perfect for two weeks 
and now I'm just going to lay down my toppings

now you're going to also need a lip that fits 
nicely on top and will let the egg steam until

the whites are completely done and then the yolks 
it's just up to you how done or how runny you want

it and it takes just a couple of minutes from this 
point on see how quick that was check this out and

the butter has brown just slightly be careful it 
burns quick but then if you let it brown like I

did you get that brown butter flavor which is 
extra nutty and then I'm just going to finish

it off with a sprinkle of black pepper white 
pepper obviously nice a little subtle heat to

go on top if you want a little extra greenery 
you can top it off with some more green onions

oh yes look how cute Betty's so typically this 
dish will also have some bread to come with it

if you want you can put some sriracha on some 
ketchup on a little extra Maggi but I'm gonna

try it as is oh the egg is perfect it's so 
perfect make sure I get some pork make sure

I pull some sausage from this side and see how 
the egg doesn't stick to the pan at all that's

because we heat it the pan to the right amount Oh 
dip the bread in the egg so good the egg is nice

and creamy pork is super flavorful I love the

on the edges of felt I people love our eggs so 
it creates a nice texture and the lab showing

the Chinese sausage is nice and sweet and chewy
